document.title: Model School Library Standards for California Public Schools, Kindergarten Through Grade Twelve

C0D604AC5E1547CC8E1D0F18495F3E37.description: Understand how media affects the telling of a story and transmission of information (e.g., illustrations, photographs, music, video).

BB27040F347240A39EF23CE5A7DABE71.description: Portray information visually to convey the main idea and supporting details about a topic.

AD153B7A45384C0C8E1FE9954CE4DEC1.description: Appreciate and respond to creative expressions of information:

7D90E82FEEC34DC3A28D2E1FE2494522.description: Inform others creatively when new information about an area of interest is learned.

0FA7CF5D6FA64AA080ED16410CC05A11.description: Share the source of the information obtained.

47B1DEEA6D274D2E88D958FBDAF5811E.description: Select and use resources in a variety of formats to support personal interests, recreational goals, and pursuits.

301FF391E87A455E82D536B82611889F.description: Read a good representation of grade-level-appropriate text, making progress toward the goal of reading 500,000 words annually by grade four (e.g., classic and contemporary literature, magazines, newspapers, online information).

8D04F91DCCFB4A069F68A6DA8EC1A8A5.description: Read widely and use various media for information, personal interest, and lifelong learning:

E519C741369242259C2AC5B2F15459FA.description: Students integrate information literacy skills into all areas of learning.

6CAC6D17555C4357A1818E94742A0AE8.description: Use a diagram or chart to illustrate a presentation.

DD561023490E46CAAB38B5904A0FC2DB.description: Communicate with other students to explore options to a problem or an ending to a story.

01A23304A59748C396DD12631E19065E.description: Record and present information with pictures, bar graphs, numbers, or written statements.

D6AF50829FAC415B8B8A119B8F40EA3E.description: Present information to convey the main idea and supporting details about a topic.

53C4CBF8E2704FCE9E88824533348B0C.description: Use information and technology creatively to answer a question, solve a problem, or enrich understanding:

82276CCE910B4D8C9FD309896E3F372E.description: Present information drawn from two sources.

CFC1A48DB79B4ACFBAE93B8EF145E489.description: Draw conclusions and make informed decisions:

6D3404E4AE664E71B1AB3168983E4CF2.description: Adhere to privacy (nondisclosure of personal or family information) and safety guidelines (laws and policies) when using the Internet at school or home.

D3424C3627184B65B7642462752758A6.description: Understand that just as there are strangers in the real world, there are also strangers on the Internet.

195C0B4AE2414196AC7DE75B8E890A3E.description: Demonstrate basic knowledge of the district or school's acceptable-use policy.

672763E683EA4E73AC7FAA181B277AD6.description: Recognize that both the author and illustrator have ownership of their own creation.

1CE84D00C9D04FF2AF4FEE7DFCA8C57D.description: Demonstrate proper procedures and good citizenship in the library and online.

EF9D380146EA4B3DAF898E019DB9BAC8.description: Demonstrate ethical, legal, and safe use of information in print, media, and online resources:

5B71E846C9FC4CE29C42B354D084BFE1.description: Recognize the need for additional information to answer questions posed by others.

91C9B3E596EB42E2A5E274444EF847B1.description: Consider the need for additional information:

9238F4643332460B9C785E56E683126D.description: Demonstrate the ability to distinguish between information and advertisements.

D415F9DFCFE44E6BA4AE6D81FB359FC5.description: Identify the purpose of an advertisement, including Internet pop-ups.

A0966B2C1DFE47DFA69EB3BCF713D62F.description: Assess the comprehensiveness, currency, credibility, authority, and accuracy of resources:

538B1D8DAD4648CD9640FFF09009467E.description: Understand that the Internet contains accurate and inaccurate information.

883BDB5EC3DA423891C12DDDCEDBA93E.description: Review facts and details to clarify and organize ideas for notetaking.

6DD2DA3F76E94F299E18479813B39B40.description: Draw meaning from illustrations, photographs, diagrams, charts, graphs, maps, and captions.

6523995268ED4A7BBF54F86B5C4F3D95.description: Determine the relevance of the information:

02FC1EAE35134F29887AFCF43E37447E.description: Identify nonfiction text structures in print and digital formats (e.g., main idea and supporting details, cause and effect, compare and contrast, sequencing).

DBCC10B2E35946279473350D3BE55A48.description: Identify main ideas of a text in preparation for notetaking.

25E8FC67590D4A37B206F22D99D1CDD3.description: Identify when it is necessary to ask an appropriate adult for assistance in seeking information in both digital and print environments.

997755C030BB41C18E5D5093931B2FA2.description: Connect prior knowledge to the information and events in text and digital formats.

A68D6F55658D442F94ED32D166B23F2B.description: Identify trusted and knowledgeable people to ask for assistance with an information search (e.g., teacher, teacher librarian, family member).

20CDA55A31D142F4AA24C9D912E0399C.description: Identify trusted places in the community where students can seek information(e.g., home, school, museums, governmental agencies, public libraries).

9BADC5A2254344A5B7D5C9B8FE56CB46.description: Retrieve information in a timely, safe, and responsible manner:

B36C2A028D89473F969069FF798AC499.description: Use graphic elements and navigational tools (e.g., buttons, icons, fields) of computer software.

B24A634339F54EBBB545FB052C095F0F.description: Identify the parts of a book (print and digital): table of contents, glossary, index, and dedication.

560C81B4A8B8417EB33C759059575506.description: Identify types of everyday print, media, and digital resources by using academic vocabulary (e.g., biography, periodical, database, fiction, nonfiction, primary source).

4699A088E4C04F4F9EF6A7C5855218A9.description: Alphabetize beyond the initial letter to locate resources.

DC97750067EA4553A7349AA7E58CE303.description: Locate age-appropriate fiction and nonfiction print, media, and digital resources in the school library.

23BE989CAA0D404899C7BA0053D01939.description: Identify whom to ask for help when using the Internet at the school library or in the classroom.

DBC5F2C80F0D4C4BB080C10414B280C3.description: Independently check out and care for a variety of library resources, including technology devices.

6D0CA9670C5D4908B6CB8A1C44AEB36A.description: Identify two sources of information that may provide an answer to the question(s).

F79B10E2A58947D7B10A9510229B9ED6.description: Identify and locate a variety of resources online and in other formats by using effective search strategies:

377F4E2CF8EC4185A0F6B28B612AA57D.description: Understand the concept of key words.

C2C3227965EB4412AA4CE9C786E33870.description: Develop questions that define the scope of investigation and connect them to the topic.

A37418C4DEE24D0592BE971799DDB96C.description: Organize prior knowledge of a subject, problem, or question (e.g., create a chart).

D8EBA7BCD7B84BA78CAF7CC32D658B7E.description: Identify a simple problem or question that needs information.
